p.s: The article is seperatedseparated into four paragraph.

The first istis informative, it has convincing numbers like Â£100mmillion, the amount of money, that was spent in one year on translating for not English speaking residents, who live in GBGreat Britain (l. 1-4).
The second paragraph is informative too (l. 5-10).
The third paragraph is also informative and the fourth paragraph is appealing.
You can see this for example by the expressions we should (l. 20) or we have to celebrate [...] (l. 18).
It's also clear in line 18 to 19 But you [...] is holding you up.
With his choice of words creates the author in the second paragraph a dramatic atmosphere.
For example no hope [...] (l. 9) or drugs abuse and crime (l. 8).

In this paragraph are also some stylistic devices, which strengthen this dramatic, negative atmosphere like the metaphor at the bottom of educational achievement (l. 7) or the personification Their society persists in [...] (ll. 7-8).
Not only in the second paragraph but also in the fourth are stylistic devices like the metaphor If someone is holding you up.
The author convinces the reader by including him and giving him a personal connection.
This happens when he uses for example My parents [...].My parents [...].My parents [...] (ll. 11-12) or with the expressions we, us (cf. l. 3, l. 4, 18, l. 20, l. 23).
He gives the reader the feeling to be a part of the article.
The author convinces the reader with his choice of words and letting him feel like he is a part of the article.
Besides he creates a dramatic, negative and appealing atmosphere by using different stylistic devices and special expressions.
